â€œIn the middle of a lake,
I lived as a water-hen.
I saw the God of Gods,
going without hurrying.
With my beak I picked up a lion,

Tissa, the Kinsman of the World.
Twenty-two thousand eons ago,
the flower I worshipped,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In the thirty-seventh (time),
there were seven with the name Kesara;
endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
